com.magnet.context.api

Interface ContextBuilder


  • public interface ContextBuilder
    Builder for Contexts

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      ContextBuilder attribute(Context.Type type, String key, Object value)
      Add an attribute to the context.
      ContextBuilder attributes(Context.Type type, Map<String,Object> attributes)
      Add attributes to the context.
      Context build()
      Build the context instance.
      String getId()
      Retrieves the current id of the context instance.
      Subject getUserSubject()
      Returns the Subject representative of the user.
      com.magnet.api.MagnetUri getUserUri()
      Retrieves the Uri of the associated user this context relates to.
      ContextBuilder id(String id)
      Set the UUID of the context instance.
      ContextBuilder parent(Context curCtx)
      Sets the parent context; this should be used with extreme caution and is reserved for advanced use cases only.
      ContextBuilder user(com.magnet.api.MagnetUri userUri)
      Set the MagnetUri for the User this context relates to.
      ContextBuilder userSubject(Subject s)
      Sets the User Subject.

    • Method Detail

      • id

        ContextBuilder id(String id)
        Set the UUID of the context instance. Once set it is immutable.

      • getId

        String getId()
        Retrieves the current id of the context instance.

      • user

        ContextBuilder user(com.magnet.api.MagnetUri userUri)
        Set the MagnetUri for the User this context relates to. Once set it is immutable.

      • getUserUri

        com.magnet.api.MagnetUri getUserUri()
        Retrieves the Uri of the associated user this context relates to.

      • getUserSubject

        Subject getUserSubject()
        Returns the Subject representative of the user.

      • userSubject

        ContextBuilder userSubject(Subject s)
        Sets the User Subject. Once set it is immutable.

      • attribute

        ContextBuilder attribute(Context.Type type,
                       String key,
                       Object value)
        Add an attribute to the context.

      • attributes

        ContextBuilder attributes(Context.Type type,
                        Map<String,Object> attributes)
        Add attributes to the context.

      • parent

        ContextBuilder parent(Context curCtx)
        Sets the parent context; this should be used with extreme caution and is reserved for advanced use cases only. Most people will not need to use this.

      • build

        Context build()
              throws PlatformRuntimeException
        Build the context instance.
        Throws:
        PlatformRuntimeException
